intro: Chytranthus gilletii, commonly known as the desert chrysalis, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It is characterized by its unique, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant has a short, hairy stem and is often found growing in rocky or sandy soils. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability. Chytranthus gilletii plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is of interest to botanists studying xerophytic adaptations.
